Introduction Many medical decisions require weighting of multiple outcomes This is typically done ad-hoc, but there are some neat MCDA applications Current MCDA applications are either not correct (based on SUCRA) or complex (Gert papers). We want to create something that is easy for clinicians to use to help make a decision

Methods Review the case study, describe methods used. Look just at primary analysis. The study had no external funding source. Statistical analysis Cite some MCDA lit + health eco, assumption that lor are normally distributed which is safe given vague priors. Baseline risks are beta distributions.

Discussion Provide a brief synopsis of key findings with particular emphasis on how the findings add to the body of pertinent knowledge. Discuss possible mechanisms and explanations for the findings. Compare study results with relevant findings from other published work. Discuss the limitations of the study and any methods used to minimize or compensate for those limitations. Mention any crucial future research directions. Summarize in a straightforward and circumspect manner the clinical implications of the work.
